statements.statement: The majority of users open facebook to see what others are doing
According to the information, most people go to Facebook to connect and communicate with friends and family, rather than solitary activities.
Most Facebook users use Facebook to connect with family & friends.
Research in 2023 has shown that the main major reason people use Facebook is to see what friends and family are up to.
The two biggest reasons people go on Facebook is to see what family and friends are up to, as well as see their pictures and videos
Facebook is intended to keep up with family and friends and see them grow up thru pictures and videos.
It seems that most people use facebook for the purposes of keeping up to date with friends and sharing photos and videos that any other facebook activities.
The majority of Facebook users are more interested in others rather than themselves.
68% of Facebook Users use the site to see what their friends and family are up to.
According to a study done by Pew Research center 68% of Facebook users, use the online networking site to keep in touch with family or friends.
People use Facebook mostly to see what family and friends are up-to and  the least to play games.
68 percent of Facebook users use it to see what friends or family are up to.
The majority of users cite keeping up with family and friends in some capacity (pictures, chatting etc.) as the main reason for using Facebook
The most common uses of Facebook are to keep up with and share in family and friends' lives.
Facebook users are more generally concerned about seeing what others are doing than sharing about themselves.
The vast majority of Facebook users visit the site to catch up with friends or family or to check their photos or videos as opposed to chatting or posting personal updates.
More and more people are relying on social media particulary facebook to stay connected with friends and family.
The trend is showing that the largest majority of people use Facebook to see what friends and family are doing.
The majority of Facebook users use the tool in order to catch up with family and friends.
The most common reason people report going to Facebook is to see what family and friends are doing.
A majority of people go to Facebook to catch up wth family and friends.
The most important trend would be the purple bars, which reallly stands out when darken.
About 2/3 of Facebook users report seeing (photos, what people are up to, etc.) as their biggest attraction to the site.
Most people use facebook to see what friends and family are up to.
The main reason people go on facebook is to see what family and friends are up to.
The 68 percent and 62 percent of Facebook users use facebook mainly to visually see what everybody else is up to.
According to recent studies, social networking giant Facebook is still a popular place to interact with family and friends online.
While a majority of people surveyed use Facebook to keep up with friends and family, a surprising 16% use it as a means of getting their news.
The most common reason for why people go on Facebook is to see what family and friends are up to.
The majority of Facebook users use the site to see what their family and friends are up to.

The graph depicts peoples use of Facebook.  It displays that people tend to go on facebook more to interact and check in on their friends, this is followed by their own personal posts and the smallest group of people reported that they went on Facebook to play games.

nuggets.nugget: Most people visit facebook to see what friends and family are up to.
Most people visit facebook to see photos and videos from family and friends.
Almost half of people visit facebook to chat or message with friends and family.
About a quarter of people visit facebook to share their photos or videos.
17% of people visit facebook to post personal updates.
16% of people visit facebook to get news.
14% of people visit facebook to play games.
More people visit facebook to get updates from friends than to post their own updates.
Far fewer people visit for news than to see what friends are up to.
